import math

def min_days_to_buy_computer(n, c, a, b):
    days = 1
    dp = [(0, 0)]
    cost = 0
    i = 0
    while True:
        if i < n - 1 and b[i] <= c:
            x = math.ceil((b[i] - cost) / a[i])
            days += x
            dp.append((cost + x * a[i], days))
        else:
            x = math.ceil((c - cost) / a[i])
            days += x
            break
        if dp[-1][0] >= c:
            break
        else:
            cost = dp[-1][0] - b[i]
            days += 1
            i += 1
    min_days = days
    for i in range(1, len(dp)):
        min_days = min(min_days, dp[i][1] + math.ceil((c - dp[i][0]) / a[i - 1]))
    return min_days
